intro: Cytisus ratisbonensis subsp. horniflorus, commonly known as the horned flame flower, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its bright yellow, tubular flowers that are clustered in dense racemes. The plant has slender, woody stems with thorn-like projections, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its leaves are small, pinnate, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and rocky habitats.
